repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Public Sector Management, Private
            Sector Finance, Rio Grande Do Sul State Reform, Rio de
            Janeiro State Reform Privatization & Mato Grosso State
            Privatization Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the projects for Brazil
            were as follows. Public Sector Management Loan: the outcome
            was moderately satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development was modest, the Bank and
            borrower performance were both unsatisfactory. Private
            Sector Finance Loan: the outcome was moderately
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development was modest, the Bank performance
            was unsatisfactory, and the borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Rio Grande Do Sul State Reform Loan: the
            outcome was moderately satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development was modest, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. Rio the Janeiro State Reform
            Privatization Loan: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development was
            modest, the Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            the borrower performance was satisfactory. Mato Grosso State
            Privatization Loan: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The major lessons of general applicability
            from the five loans assessed include: Continuity of Bank
            interventions is important for promoting lasting
            institutional change. Sub-national programmatic loans offer
            advantages, in this respect, over time-bound State Reform
            Loan (SRLs). The principles of the Levy Report remain
            relevant for designing financial sector lending operations.
            Credit lines (financial intermediary loans) are unlikely to
            be appropriate instruments for supporting financial sector
            adjustment. Reconciling project expenditures fully and
            correctly at closing is a core Bank responsibility. An
            oversight agency operating within an appropriate regulatory
            framework is an important prerequisite to successful
            privatization of public services. As investment loans, the
            SRLs proved to be cumbersome instruments for supporting
            structural change.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Sector Management Loan
            Project will support specific measures to strengthen public
            sector management. These will include a program for the
            Ministry of Planning to develop planning and management
            capacity in the areas of sector and project analysis,
            multi-year investment planning and program monitoring. Also
            implemented will be a program for the Secretariat for State
            Enterprises to institute a performance evaluation system for
            all state enterprises under its supervision and to develop
            rehabilitation programs for 30 of these state enterprises.
            Established by the new National Treasury Secretariat of the
            Ministry of Finance, will be an integrated budget
            information and control system, and an improved system for
            the control of Governments assets administration. Further to
            this will be management training programs for Ministry staff
            and priority economic and social research.
